Tight end Brent Celek agreed, when he spoke via phone yesterday with a group of reporters from his minivacation getaway in Michigan: Sometimes he's taking some big-time hits, where maybe other guys would get flagged and he's not. Hopefully, they change it. He's a quarterback, too. He's the same as everybody else. Just because he's maybe a little bit more athletic and faster and can run, he shouldn't be penalized. for an executive who is transitioning out of the CEO role_ and may even be unusual for sitting CEOs, said David Wise, senior principal at management consulting firm Hay Group. But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. `` It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat,'' Wise added. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as Google Inc. 's CEO by co-founder Larry Page.

CEO Steve Ballmer outlined their new partnership in an analysts' meeting in London today, painting a picture of Nokia as Microsoft's premiere Windows Phone partner and of Windows Phone as Nokia's core smartphone platform. Nokia will adopt Windows Phone as our primary smartphone strategy, Stephen Elop said.`` We will help drive the future of the platform, and we will bring Windows Phone to extended price points, market segments and geographies.''
